The good:An interesting mix of Sunset Overdrive, Jet Set Radio, rhythm game and Generator Rex (a cartoon that also had its game on Xbox 360). Characters with excessive charisma. It is very reminiscent of the Sunset Overdrive expansion where you face mechs and robots. It is irreverent, unexpected, entertaining. Colorful graphics. It has a Crackdown mechanic where you have to defeat the landlords to go to the end and they drop more and more fierce and powerful enemies, before seeing the final boss (also very similar to Shadow of Mordor's Nemesis mode). Various game modes included in the main game, rhythm game, imitate patterns, 2D platformer, time attack. It's on Xbox Game Pass so get into it without fear. The bad:Small frame drops (they don't worsen the gaming experience and maybe they'll be fixed with a patch). It's a festival of Cartoon and anime clichés (breaking the fourth wall, script armor, moments of grief, you can't take it seriously even though the characters take it solemnly). Very short (I'm hoping for some expansion to continue expanding the experience. If you don't like Japanese, it's not a game for you. Lo Meh!:Sega has always been asked for a sequel to Jet Ser Radio Future (Original Xbox) or Sunset Overdrive 2 (before Sony bought Insomniac) and it's good that it came from Tango Games and Shinji Mikami. By the way, many forget that Shinji Mikami and his team had already surprised us with Beautiful Joe before, so I don't understand the complaints.

An incredible game that's only possible thanks to the incredible service that is Xbox Game Pass. The Game Pass model bypasses all of the issues that make modern single-player games inevitably devolve into big, slow and mind-numbingly boring 100 hours endeavours to stay competitive in the market of individually purchased games. Free from all this pressure, Hi-Fi Rush developers were able to focus on the only thing that should truly matter: making the game fun. And fun it is. Incredible job Tango Gameworks, and thank you Xbox/Bethesda for publishing this game. I hope Game Pass continues to thrive so that we all may enjoy more of these games.

Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo de seu tio, então o instalamos em seu computador e ele começou a jogar. Até o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horrível para mim, pois já era difícil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele está sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Então eu decidi fazer uma conta no Steam e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha skin e mundo e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que você deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde então, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa também. Este jogo me lembrou que há diversão em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembranças felizes para mim e meu filho.

Hi-Fi Rush is a fast-paced rhythm game that challenges players to keep up with the beat as they navigate a futuristic world filled with neon lights and electrifying music. One of the strongest points of Hi-Fi Rush is its vibrant and colorful presentation. The game's futuristic world is beautifully rendered, and the neon lights and electric beats create an immersive and energetic atmosphere. The game's soundtrack is also noteworthy, featuring a mix of electronic and dance music that perfectly matches the fast-paced action of the game. In terms of gameplay, Hi-Fi Rush is a thrilling and intense experience. The controls are tight and responsive, and the game's challenging rhythm-based levels require quick reflexes and precise timing. The game's level design is well-done, offering a good mix of easy and challenging levels that are sure to test players' skills. However, there are a few areas where the game falls short. One issue is the length of the game, which some players may find to be on the short side. Additionally, the game's difficulty can sometimes feel unbalanced, with some sections being overly difficult and others feeling too easy. Despite these minor shortcomings, Hi-Fi Rush is still a fantastic rhythm game that is sure to provide an exciting and challenging gaming experience. The game's vibrant presentation and electrifying soundtrack make it a great choice for fans of rhythm games or anyone looking for an energetic and fast-paced gaming experience. All in all, I would rate Hi-Fi Rush an 8 out of 10. The game is a solid rhythm game that is sure to provide an exciting and challenging gaming experience for players of all skill levels. If you're looking for a fast-paced and immersive rhythm game, Hi-Fi Rush is definitely worth checking out.

The game was a pleasant surprise through and through . Really reminds me of older games , that throw you into the fun right away . The game is full of charm , cheerful character and quirkiness that are done right and not in a cringe way . One of the things you notice almost immediately , is of course the art-direction . The art style is a breath of fresh air , that puts a smile into your face and you adore every minute looking at the world around you . The key element of the game is of course it's gameplay . It's a rythme action adventure game that is carried with rock n roll music. It's extremely satisfying hitting the combo in the right beat,  it kinda makes it addictive and you want to improve in every step of the way . The gameplay , in my opinion , is a bit slow to get into . It has a learning curve , that encompasses a lot of mechanics that should flow into the rythme of the game and can be frustrating at the begging . Once you get all the mechanics , you'll start enjoying the game way more . It isn't easy game , it actually on the harder side but of course the reason I would say it's hard is because you want to get that S GRADE ! One of the weakest aspect is the story , but it picks up after a while and it's carried by amazing performances of voice actors and animators that have done an amazing job of fleshing the game out and adding a character to it . Music is great , it offers wide variety of original tracks that were made specifically for the game and you won't get bored of listening to the same songs . The sound is also incredible , the whole game is synchronized with you and every hit or step you take follows the beat of a song .The technical aspect is incredible . A game that released out of nowhere and in the same day that it was announced , I was blown away on how well it run . I played it on series s and it run at stable 60 FPS , with one minor bug . So to conclude the game is extremely well done , that is full of passion and talent behind it . It offers you fun right away . It has extremely impressive art style , cool music , character and gameplay that is addictive and fun but it takes time to pick up .I strongly recommend it if you want to spend quality time , while shutting your brains off . After hearing about all the praise for this game coming out of ABSOLUTELY NOWHERE, I signed up for Game Pass and bought an Xbox controller to specifically play it on my cheap $150 laptop. Hi-Fi Rush almost no flaws I can think of. Part of why that's so surprising is because there are so many gameplay elements that, when looked at individually, could easily devolve into cheap gimmicks. Tango Gameworks did NOT take that route and instead put their hearts and souls into crafting something that feels fun and nostalgic, yet fresh and new. The game's setting is beautiful, the gameplay is ridiculously addictive, all of the characters are relentlessly charming with PHENOMENAL voice direction, the visuals are pure pop art insanity and that soundtrack... ...SWEET CRUMPETS THAT SOUNDTRACK. Imagine if Devil May Cry, Rhythm Heaven, Jet Set Radio and Persona 5 went to karaoke night at a dive bar in Tokyo and formed a dream team prog rock band due to their immensely popular cover of "Baka Mitai". Desarrollado por Tango Gameworks y publicado por Bethesda Softworks, Hi-Fi RUSH es un juego de acción y ritmo para un jugador en donde tomarás el mando de Chai, protagonista de este juego que es sumamente carismático, divertido, colorido y emocionante. El juego comienza con la participación de Chai en el "Proyecto Armstrong", en el que su corazon se fusiona con su reproductor de música y también recibe un brazo metálico. Al fusionarse con el reproductor de música, Chai se sincroniza con el ritmo de cada canción. Los enemigos y el ambiente también están sincronizados con la música. Chai unirá fuerzas con diferentes personajes para luchar en contra de los distintos departamentos y cada uno de los jefes asociados a los respectivos departamentos y así detener al CEO Kale Vandelay y la compañía Vandelay Technologies.El combate es bastante básico pero entretenido. Tienes ataques livianos, ataques pesados, ataques brincando, ataques especiales, puedes esquivar ataques , y también mezclar tus ataques usando a tus aliados. Podrás comprar nuevos ataques especiales/habilidades y combos para Chai y sus compañeros, con Gears (engranajes). Consigues gears derrotando enemigos, encontrándolos por el mundo y completando desafíos. Pero eso no es todo. Podrás comprar circuitos, fichas y ropa (después de terminar el juego) para Chai y otros personajes. Mientras vas jugando, encontrarás distintos robots y variantes. Cada uno con su distinta forma de atacar y derrotar.Los jefes de cada departamento son sumamente distintos y las batallas son diferentes a la anterior. Son memorables,  entretenidas y algunas hasta graciosas.El juego cuenta con accesibilidad,  como por ejemplo: incrementar el tamaño de letra en el interfaz de usuario, subtitulos de contexto,  modo auto-acción, entre otras cosas. No quiero entrar en "spoilers" so, no hablaré de la historia. Pero les puedo decir que el juego es una joya. Mientras lo jugaba,  me sentía que estaba jugando un video juego del Dreamcast.La música, los personajes, la historia, la jugabilidad, todo... se convierte en un clásico instantáneo. El estilo artístico parece sacado directamente de un cómic, y el doblaje hace que parezca un dibujo animado de los que veía los sábados por la mañana.

Hi-Fi Rush isn't the type of game I'd pick up and play, but I heard so many things about it that I just had to try it (thank you, Game Pass). It sorta ended up being what I already expected, with a few surprises along the way. This game is downright gorgeous! The animations, vibrant colors, cutscenes, character design and even the visual cues were amazing. It makes you feel comfortable to play, while doing it all in style. The level design is also quite amazing. At times I loved the platforming moments, little puzzles and just traversing through areas way more interesting than the battle system. Unfortunately, the story and writing are very dumb and obvious. I know that its silliness can actually be intentional, but I just couldn't do it with the dialogue and the lack of development on the plot and its characters. I loved the presentation and the cast/villains were quite charming, but I couldn't care for them. Honestly, the worst aspect of the game. But the real deal here is the combat. A weird mix between Devil May Cry and, I don't know, Guitar Hero, I guess. For me, it worked. Not always, but it did work. It took a long time to click, but it was fun when it did. The thing that bothered me the most was that, sometimes, it didn't really feel like I was doing combos on the beat when I KNEW that I was. And yes, I checked and tweaked things in the options menu. Also, sometimes I was more focused on the beat than in actually moving forward. It's very strange, but there is beauty in it. The bosses were hilights for me, the enemy variety is interesting but sort of lacking (some of them, like the bird and the samurai, are annoying as hell), the environments look very good but are somewhat repetitive and combos were cool to pull off but buying them on the store didn't seem to shake up the combat that much. One other thing that was a bit of a hit or miss for me was the music. I think that's what kept me from enjoying this game more. The licensed music is great. I never thought I'd actually fight a video game boss to the sound of NIN, Number Girl and even a Flaming Lips cover. That was amazing. As for the original music? It was bland and forgettable. And for a game that puts music as the forefront of its design, it needed to be awesome. Hi-Fi Rush is not my type of game, but it's a fun experience, for sure! I liked how entertaining, charming, imaginative and technical it is, but I did not fall in love with its cast, story, world and, most importantly, music. If you have Game Pass, though, you should definitely give it a try!

Une surprise ! Ce jeu de Tango Gameworks qui sort immédiatement suite à son annonce.Un jeu vraiment superbe, très peu de points négatifs me viennent à l'esprit après mon aventure dans Hi-Fi Rush. Un jeu au prix de 30 euros sachant qu'il est également dans le GamePass c'est vraiment ne pas se moquer du joueur, de plus je n'ai subi aucun bug dans toute mon expérience, il est techniquement maitrisé. Ce jeu mérite l'attention des joueurs, j'espère qu'il ne passera pas sous les radars.Savant mélange de jeu de plateforme, action et jeu de rythme il a réussi ce mélange tout en rendant cela équilibré/cohérent avec la cerise sur le gâteau : Une direction artistique rafraichissante. Le coté rythmique est omniprésent.Ce n'est pas pour me déplaire car ca en découle des décors, combats, mouvements et pleins d'autres détails qui font cette saveur si satisfaisante, de plus le jeu récompense le joueur dans son engagement à suivre le tempo de la musique et ne le laisse pas sans indice. l'Histoire est efficace, les personnages peuvent être légèrement cliché mais fonctionnent super bien et surtout l'humour m'a énormément touché sans suivre la voie "facile" du running gag.Beaucoup de références sont servies également, de quoi faire sourire une fois de plus. Des fois je me demande si il est "classique" mais je pense que non, il m'inspire plus une sorte de modernisation d'un style de jeu dépassé si j'ose dire, dans son genre il marque des points à tous les niveaux selon moi sachant qu'il possède ce coté rythme en plus qui fait la différence. Un jeu dont le studio a mis de l'amour (j'ai l'impression), en tout cas on se sent bien dans Hi-Fi Rush ! PS : Je n'ai pas encore fait le post-game.

From its simple yet elaborate story, HI-FI Rush is a once-a-generation game. Rhythm games were long forgotten and this may have been the starting point for new games in this style. The lore is simple but perfectly matches the style of play, the characters are well written and full of personality, the world is bright and very well thought out, nothing in this game feels repetitive or boring; the vivid color scheme set a different tone without being too childish. Humor is one of the points to consider, it may not suit everyone but it definitely puts you in the position of wanting to play more and more to understand what each character wants and why they are there. The protagonist is the typical hyperactive and young boy who doesn't stop throwing comments all the time, almost as if you were using the sarcastic option in every line while playing Fallout 4. In summary Hi-Fi Rush is the most pleasant surprise of the year, I've never seen it happen before, a surprise release and without any exuberant and impossible promises, just down to earth, a game that is not afraid to be a game, without a movie, no father-son drama with arc and post apocalyptic world, just GAME.

Good-Incredible soundtrack; Unique rhythm-based combat that doesn’t penalize the rhythmless; Wonderful characters, writing, and visuals. Bad-The best parts of the game are very latency-sensitive. Thoughts-With massive releases just on the horizon, it’s kind of crazy to think that a shadow-dropped game with a relatively brief 10-hour runtime might be the best thing we see all year. Its charm and style alone could carry it, but the passion behind the project, the love and care that was put into it, is something that hasn’t been felt or seen since some of the best games of 2022, and look how that turned out. Even though it has flashes of games that came before, Hi-Fi Rush is a unique, masterful game that accomplishes everything it sets out to with plenty of style and charm to spare. Tango Gameworks should be proud.

Hi-Fi Rush, released the same day as it was announced by Tango Gameworks, is a complete breath of fresh air and an unexpected early contender to the 2023 game of the year competition. Hi-Fi Rush is a rhythm based character action game, the type and style of game that has kind of fallen by the wayside and you would of definitely found on the PS2 or the Gamecube.The game, its action, and its environments are all moving and in sync the beat of the music. While the music changes between levels and events it is always staying on the same simple beat. The game is more forgiving than typical rhythm games as everything still happens on the beat whether you miss it or not but you get bonuses the closer you press on the beat. I was struggling with these aspects until maybe the 4th level when you get the parry ability and it all kind of came around for me. It is extremely satisfying to land perfect attacks, dodges, and parries all of which are beautifully animated.The cel-shaded graphics are absolutely perfectly displayed and animated here. All the colors, characters, and animations are absolutely popping on the screen. It is simply one of the better and more pleasing games to look at over the last few years.The story and characters are also a strongpoint of the game. Chai, the main character, is an endless fountain of positivity which shines through and over powers his kind of stupid and simple nature. The side characters and corporate bosses are all perfectly set to bounce off of Chai and wonderfully voice acted.The only real issues is the required quick time events which can be challenging and break up the perfect flow of the game.

✅HI-FI RUSH – PRIMEIRAS IMPRESSÕES Lançado do nada e sem qualquer aviso prévio da existência do jogo, Hi-Fi Rush, novo título da Tango Gameworks, caiu na graça dos gamers com sua proposta rítmica e muitas cores. O diretor John Johanas revelou em um podcast que o estúdio começou a trabalhar no game desde 2017 e disse também quais foram as inspirações para o jogo. Gráfico / Iluminação – (muito bom)O jogo traz um estilo bem diferente dos que estamos acostumados a ver hoje em dia. Ele está mais puxado para um estilo cartoon de HQ. Uma das inspirações para Hi-Fi Rush foram os jogos da era Xbox, PlayStation 2 e Dreamcast, que eram "muito coloridos, claros e divertidos" Jogabilidade / gameplay – (ótima)O jogo traz uma proposta diferente de gameplay. Toda a jogabilidade é baseada em ritmo, ou seja, absolutamente tudo que se movimenta no jogo, incluindo combates, dashs e combos, é ritmado ou se preferir, acompanha a batida da música. Trilha sonora – (ótima)A trilha sonora do jogo é um show a parte e na minha visão foi algo pensado com muito cuidado e carinho. Para começar, o jogo conta com repertórios conhecidos, mas, aí vem a parte que me chamou a atenção: existe um “modo streamer”! Como ele funciona, basicamente é se você for fazer live do jogo, quando ativado, o jogo traz músicas originais do jogo, ou seja, a chance de o canal levar algum direito autoral é bem pequeno. ConclusãoAté o momento

When I first saw HiFi Rush, my first impression was 'a cartoon with Metal Hellsinger gameplay', .and while it'd be easy to generalise it that way, HiFiRush delves much, much deeper. Starting with the looks, sure it's cartoon'y, almost anime like, but the quality, fluidity and overall presentation is on par with the best animated movies you could think of, There's a reason so many screenshots look so good, because in action, even in action-packed sections, it looks this good all the time. As for gameplay, the "metal Hellsinger" vibes put me off at first glance but that changed as soon as I picked up the controller. Sure enjoyed Hellsinger, but I found the rhythm based gameplay punishing and annoying..With Hifi Rush, is completely different, Sire my score might take a hit, but I never felt punished by missing a combo, it was rewarding when I did, and Id try my best, but if you missed one, you where still doing some decent damage. Add to this that the entire world is literally vibing, signs in the background, your companion 808, items nearby, the constant visual beat makes that rhythym easier to accomplish, even with the sound turned down. You certainly won't want to turn that sound down as there's some great music, mostly capped off with the boss fights and some fantastic licensed tracks.It's usually tough to review a GamePass game, because the value of Gamepass conflicts with the value of the overall game, but at only £29.99 it's fantastic value even at full price, It's a bald statement but HiFi Rush is considerably better than most games that cost twice as much.If you have gamepass, there's no reason at all you should be reading this review trying to work out if it's actually "that good", Just download it now, you won't be dissapointed.

É simplesmente incrível, o jogo vai contra a maior parte da indústria que foca em realismo, extremo hype, conteudo repetitivo... E o Hi- Fi foi totalmente ao contrário, tendo o anuncio e publicação no mesmo dia.O jogo ti introduz em uma nova forma de jogar com os ritmos, de quebra aprendendo como uma música funciona, ele ti emerge no mundo colocando o proprio mundo no ritmo.O progresso é delicioso, não me senti pressionada a ter que explorar, fazer side quest, procurar colecionáveis, etc... Para prosseguir.Você acaba procurando pelo prazer de re-jogar os mapas, dando um bom replay a ele.Os gráficos não pecam em nada, rodando liso na plataforma Xbox Series, sem ter que escolher entre modo performance ou fidelidade.Como um jogo rítmico, para quem não tem costume, pode haver uma demora para conseguir fazer os combos perfeitos, porem o jogo não exige perfeição, e ti da tempo e espaço para aprender no seu tempo, com varios indicativos.A acessibilidade é muito boa, com suporte a varios niveis de daltonismo, combos "Semi-Automaticos", assistência para se usar apenas um botão, retirada de vibrações na tela, retirada de efeitos específicos...A adaptação Brasileira está impecável, com piadas boas, vozes incríveis e times perfeitos, não se passa 5 minutos sem uma piada, frase maneira, contexto da história de fundo, e sons de guitarra com a boca. Com certeza é uma das melhores adaptações junto com the last of us part 2.Felizmente procurar problemas no jogo é difícil, porem tenho pequenas ressalvas, acredito que poderia ter a inversão da direção de onde vem a indicação visual do ritmo, ouvez de vir dos lados, poderia partir do centro até as extremidades, facilitando para quem vem de outros jogos, e também tendo um auxílio do ritmo diferente; O movimento do personagem no ar pode ser com pouco pesado, causando estranheza por jogos de plataforma serem mais leves, mas com pulo duplo e esquiva, você não se frusta por isso, virando apenas um leve desconforto para algumas pessoas no início; O jogo é extremamente barato, custando um terço dos jogos AAA e estando no game pass, porem a versão Deluxe Edition é desnecessária, as poucas customizações inclusas exclusivamente nela poderiam ser incluídas no jogo base, entendo que a essa versão pode ajudar a capitar mais por ser colecionáveis desejáveis e sendo exclusivas da versão Deluxe que acrescenta pouco a mais no preço, mas preferiria que o jogo base já viesse com esse conteúdo, mesmo custando mais.Os pequenos defeitos que me incomodaram são irrelevantes ou ínfimos, sendo apenas pequenas contradições com minha opinião.O jogo entrega tudo que de propõe e surpreende a cada segundo, não tenho dúvidas que seu nome vai reverberar por muito tempo ainda. Valendo cada centavo e tempo gasto, tenho a certeza que o jogo é digno de uma nota 10 com orgulho, entrando no marco dos jogos, deixando sua batida inesquecível.

Hi-Fi Rush pode ser descrito como uma surpresa positiva. Seu sistema de combate é incrível, e mesmo sendo bem parecido durante todo o jogo não cai na mesmisse devido aos elementos de jogabilidade novos que vão sendo adicionados com a progressão da história. Os combos, os diversos aliados e até mesmo os ataques especiais juntamente com as músicas deixam o jogo bem mais dinâmico. A luta contra o penúltimo chefe com a música "Wolfgang's 5th Symphony" representa o melhor encaixe entre cena e música que o jogo tem a oferecer. A história não é a mais inovadora do mundo, mas faz o básico de um futuro muito tecnológico em que uma organização quer dominar o mundo bem feito. JAPANESE DUB IS THE WAY TO GO!!I swear if you want to experience the game differently, try playing it on Japanese dub coz it's so good! The voice actors that they cast are not just any other VA. It's like watching an anime! Like for instance, Kale (the last boss), his Japanese voice is played by Takehito Koyasu who is well known voice of Dio from jojo Bizarre. Definitely a good contender for the Game Of The Year. I spent hours of gaming and currently on a post-game completing it on rhythm master mode. The game is a masterpiece! I am not even a fan of these type of music but I ended up vibing with it. Specially the song from one of the bosses. Ugh! it is super good. The battle system is so unique and so badass. It would leave you feel good about yourself coz you're doing these combos easily. one of my favorites in the battle mode is the assist. In, fighting games like Marvel vs Capcom 2, Power Rangers, etc. Assist is one of important in combo and it gives additional flavor to it. I feel like they hit the spot on that. It feels so good when you are on over 100 hit combo doing assist and even have specials with your assist too! Even after finishing the game there's still a lot of things to do. There's a tower you can clear out, you can go back to previous levels to unlock some of the locked stages that you saw from your first run through, you can complete painting on the wall, etc. These are the reasons why I didn't give it a perfect 10: 1. I wish we have an option to reset a boss fight from the very beginning. All bosses have at least 3 phases, and it acts like a check point. If you die in mid boss fight, you'd respawn on the last phase/check point. I kinda like it to have an option to start from the very beginning of the boss fight. 2. Costumes are only accessible after finishing the game. It would've been better if customization (clothes) is accessible from your first run through. The character that let you customize is just standing in the hide out doing nothing. 3. I kinda wish that we wouldn't need to finish the Easy, Normal and Hard difficulty if we've finished the game on Very Hard Mode for achievement.
